pageContext.claim: “I wish, frankly, that the media would report how well we're doing in manufacturing, how well we're doing with the economy. They don't seem to report how well we're doing.”
pageContext.analysis: Major news organizations routinely and prominently report positive economic developments. Manufacturing job gains that began under President Barack Obama have continued mostly at the same pace under Trump. The number of manufacturing jobs in the United States has slowly recovered from the Great Recession but is still almost 1 million jobs below the level when the recession started in December 2007.
